intro: Strobilanthes bilabiata, commonly known as the "Bilabiata" or "Moth Plant," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, bilabiate (two-lipped) flowers that resemble moth wings, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its flowering period occurs during the monsoon season, and it is known for its ornamental value. Strobilanthes bilabiata is also of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal properties.
